snippet: Late additions to the bill included diminishing job protections for teachers, which would almost certainly become a thorny campaign issue for Gov. Sam Brownback should he sign the measure.
abstract: Kansas lawmakers pass education finance bill that will send more money to the state's poor school districts, grant tax breaks for corporations that donate to private school scholarship funds aimed at low-income students and end hearing process granted to most teachers if they are to be fired; Gov Sam Brownback has yet to say whether he will sign bill that could complicate his re-election bid.
lead_paragraph: Late additions to the bill included diminishing job protections for teachers, which would almost certainly become a thorny campaign issue for Gov. Sam Brownback should he sign the measure.

headline.main: School Funding Deal in Kansas Complicates Governor’s Campaign for Re-election
headline.print_headline: School Funding Deal in Kansas Complicates Governor’s Campaign for Re-election
